required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Exufiber Versus Aquacel Extra in Moderately or Strongly Exuding Venous and Mixed Ulcers of Predominantly Venous Origin
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Multi-centre Non-inferiority Investigation to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Exufiber Versus Aquacel Extra in Moderately or Strongly Exuding Venous and Mixed Ulcers of Predominantly Venous Origin

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigation is designed as an open, randomized, non-inferiority, multi-centre investigation.
212 evaluable subjects will be randomised. Subjects to be included will suffer from an exuding venous or mixed ulcer of predominantly venous origin. Subjects will either be randomized to Exufiber®Gelling Fibre Dressing or Aquacel®Extra Hydrofiber® Dressing with Strengthening Fibre using, centralized randomization

detailed_description.textblock: Visits are planned for baseline followed by 1, 2, 3, 4 and 6 weeks post treatment. The sub-group of at least 50 subjects will also be followed at week 8, 12, 16, 20, and 24 post treatment or until wound is healed if earlier.

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint was to measure relative reduction of wound area (%) from baseline to end of investigation (up to 6 weeks measured by the validated system PictZar on the photos taken after debridement at week 0, week 4, and week 6 (or final visit if healed earlier)

secondary_outcome.description: The secondary endpoint was to measure relative reduction of wound area (cm2) from baseline to end of investigation (up to 6 weeks measured by the validated system PictZar on the photos taken after debridement at week 0, week 4, and week 6 (or final visit if healed earlier)

Linear advance of the wound margin according to Gilman's formula (G= [(A0-An) / ((P0+Pn) / 2)] / Time) was calculated and evaluated using the validated system PictZar on the photos taken after debridement. The values represent wound margin advanced inwards over time (i.e., reduction in perimeter) presented in cm/day.
Pain was reported by patients and measured by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) 0-100mm, where 0=is no pain, 100=is worst pain ever.
Pain was reported by patients and measured by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) 0-100mm, where 0=is no pain, 100=is worst pain ever.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Clinicians of Opinion 'Very Good' for Dressing Features
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician reported outcomed by means a questionnaire was used to capture opinions related to the two dressing types. Reply alternatives varied between very poor, poor, good, very good. Results reported as 'very good' are presented as a percentage based on all follow-up visits aggregated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Clinicians of Opinion 'Does Not Adhere' Related to Dressing Features
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician reported outcomed by means a questionnaire was used to capture opinions related to the two dressing types. Reply alternatives varied between does not adhere, adhere a little, adhere a lot. Results reported as 'does not adhere' are presented as a percentage based on all follow-up visits aggregated.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Healed Wounds
other_outcome.description: Wound healing assessments were based on blind independent clinical review of photos.

intervention.intervention_name: Aquacel Extra Hydrofiber® Dressing with Strengthening Fibre

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provision of informed consent i.e. subject must be able to understand and sign the Patient Information and Consent Form
2. Both gender ≥18 years old
3. Ulcer moderately or strongly exudative justifying the use of an absorbent dressing
4. (History of compression at least two weeks before inclusion) Deleted in Am.2
5. (Wound covered with slough ≥70%) Deleted in Am.4
6. 0.7≤ABPI<1.3
7. Ulcer duration 6 weeks to 60 months
8. Ulcer size 3 cm2-100 cm2
9. Target ulcer at least 3 cm away from any other lesion
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known allergy/hypersensitivity to the dressings
2. Pregnant or breastfeeding
3. Circumferential wounds (the entire wound should be able to be captured on a single image/photo)
4. Subjects who will have problems following the protocol
5. Subjects included in other ongoing clinical investigation evaluating wound dressings at present or during the past 30 days
6. Patient with a systemic infection not controlled by suitable antibiotic treatment
7. Clinically infected wound according to the judgement of the investigator (heat, pain, swelling, redness or purulent secretion)
8. Wound covered with black necrosis
9. Dry wounds
10. Malignant wound degeneration
11. Current treatment with radiotherapy, chemotherapy, immunosuppressant drugs or high doses of oral corticosteroids if any
12. Subject with deep vein thrombosis within 3 months prior to inclusion

clinical_study.keyword: wound reduction wound healing, venous ulcers

group.title: Exufiber
group.description: Investigational Device: Exufiber® gelling fibre dressing as primary dressing to facilitate moist healing of venous leg ulcer.

group.title: Aquacel
group.description: Comparator - Aquacel® Extra™ Hydrofiber® Dressing with Strengthening Fibre as primary dressing to facilitate moist healing of venous leg ulcer.

outcome.title: Wound Area Change (%)
outcome.description: The primary endpoint was to measure relative reduction of wound area (%) from baseline to end of investigation (up to 6 weeks measured by the validated system PictZar on the photos taken after debridement at week 0, week 4, and week 6 (or final visit if healed earlier)
outcome.population: PP analysis set, tested for non-inferiority

group.title: Exufiber
group.description: Investigational device, Exufiber Gelling Fibre Dressing

group.title: Aquacel
group.description: Comparator, Aquacel® Extra™ Hydrofiber® dressing with strengthening fibre

measure.title: Wound Area Change (%)
measure.description: The primary endpoint was to measure relative reduction of wound area (%) from baseline to end of investigation (up to 6 weeks measured by the validated system PictZar on the photos taken after debridement at week 0, week 4, and week 6 (or final visit if healed earlier)
measure.population: PP analysis set, tested for non-inferiority
measure.units: relative wound area change in percentage

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: In this non-inferiority study the primary efficacy analysis included constructing a two sided 95% confidence interval, using Fisher's non-parametric permutation test, for between-treatment differences (Exufiber - Aquacel Extra) in the mean percentage area change from baseline to 6 weeks. This means that if the lower limit of this confidence interval was found to be greater than 12%, non-inferiority will be established.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event were collected while subjects participated in the study, i.e. from the baseline visit, to 6 or 24 weeks follow-up, or until wound healing/premature study termination. h

group.title: Exufiber
group.description: Investigational device, Exufiber Gelling fibre dressing

group.title: Aquacel
group.description: Comparator, Aquacel® Extra™ Hydrofiber® Dressing with Strengthening Fibre

event.sub_title: Circulatory insufficiency with dehydration and dizziness

event.description: Patient was fallen down and broke her left arm. Of Cause of that she needs an Operation and was in hospital.
Intensification of depression symptoms in course of schizophrenia
Death unknown cause in the Aquacel group. Death due to acute renal failure in the Exufiber group
Patient has increase pain, the wound status is going worse

event.sub_title: Local signs of infection at the target wound
Pain in back due to fall

event.description: Severe irritation around the wound. The dressing was done every 2 days with 2 Aquacel on the wound, contrary to the instructions of the protocol (a daily frequency with only 1 AQUACEL on the wound).
Wound infection right leg, and Increased redness in peri-wound skin.
The wound was covered with lots of blue-green-coloured slough, which Looks like pseudomonas
Small skin blister and wound on the leg at the at area of dressing tape

event.sub_title: Strong itching in the marginal area of the wound
Fall at home with wound in the right leg
Erysipel of nonstudy leg - left leg
Increasing the ulcer with inflammatory reaction
Periwound skin irritation and blistering in study wound
Redness and irritation on Periwound Skin on left leg study ulcer .
Stinging or burning while wearing study product
Eczema with tingling and pain on right foot
Pain of the wound unrelated to the dressing

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
